NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ImagingObjectSelection DomainResourceKey Object Selection
uid 1..1oidInstance UID
patient 1..1PatientPatient of the selected objects
title 1..1CodeableConceptReason for selection
KOStitle (Example)
description 0..1stringDescription text
author 0..1Practitioner | Device | Organization | Patient | RelatedPersonAuthor (human or machine)
authoringTime 0..1dateTimeAuthoring time of the selection
study 1..*ElementStudy identity of the selected instances
uid 1..1oidStudy instance uid
retrieveAETitle 0..1idAE Title where may be retrieved
retrieveUrl 0..1uriRetrieve URL
series 1..*ElementSeries identity of the selected instances
uid 1..1oidSeries instance uid
retrieveAETitle 0..1idAE Title where may be retrieved
retrieveUrl 0..1uriRetrieve URL
instance I1..*ElementThe selected instance
SHALL at least provide retrieve URL or retrieve AE Title
sopClass 1..1oidSOP class uid of instance
uid 1..1oidUid of the selected instance
retrieveAETitle I0..1idAE Title where may be retrieved
retrieveUrl I0..1uriRetrieve URL

element.formal: A set of DICOM SOP Instances of a patient, selected for some application purpose, e.g., quality assurance, teaching, conference, consulting, etc.  Objects selected can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
element.requirements: A FHIR representation of DICOM Key Object Selection (KOS) SOP Instances enables access to a set of selected DICOM SOP Instances.

element.formal: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resoure. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.formal: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the url. This values changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comments: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.formal: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comments: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant.

element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.formal: A list of profiles that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to Profile.url.
element.comments: It is up to the server and/or other infrastruture of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over tiem.

element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.formal: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comments: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.

element.formal: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comments: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.formal: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: Instance UID of the DICOM KOS SOP Instances represenetd in this resource.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP Instance is always assigned with a unique identifier (UID).

mapping.map: (0008,0018) - SOP Instance UID (of the Key Object Selection SOP Class)
(0008,0018) - SOP Instance UID (of the Key Object Selection SOP Class)

element.formal: A patient resource reference which is the patient subject of all DICOM SOP Instances in this key object selection.
element.comments: SOP instances selected in the key object selection can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
element.requirements: SOP Instances in key object selection must be from the same patient.

mapping.map:
(0010,0010) - Patient Name
(0010,0020) - Patient ID
(0010,0021) - Issuer of Patient ID

(0010,0010) - Patient Name
(0010,0020) - Patient ID
(0010,0021) - Issuer of Patient ID

element.formal: The reason for, or significance of, the selection of objects referenced in the resource.
element.comments:
Coded concept of kind of the key object selection. Value set is defined in the DICOM standard CID-7010.

http://medical.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/sect_CID_7010.html.
element.requirements: Need to represent the application purpose that the SOP instances in key object selection are selected for.

binding.name: KOStitle
binding.description: The document title code of key object selection

mapping.map: (0040,A043) - Concept Name Code Sequence in the SR root item
(0040,A043) - Concept Name Code Sequence in the SR root item

element.formal: Text description of the DICOM SOP instances selected in the key object selection. This should be aligned with the content of the title element, and can provide further explanation of the SOP instances in the selection.
element.comments: Free text narrative description of the key object selection.
element.requirements: Need to provide a narrative description of the SOP instances in the selection.

mapping.map:
(0040,A160) - Text Value
SR content item immediately under the root item, concept name code = (113012, DCM, "Key Object Description")

(0040,A160) - Text Value
SR content item immediately under the root item, concept name code = (113012, DCM, "Key Object Description")

element.formal: Author of key object selection. It can be a human authtor or a device which made the decision of the SOP instances selected. For example, a radiologist selected a set of imaging SOP instances to attached in a diagnostic report, and a CAD application may author a selection to describe SOP instances it used to generate a detection conclusion.
element.comments: Author of the key object selection. This can be a human author or a device author. Human author is represented with the HumanName type. Device author is represented with a reference to the Device resource.
element.requirements: Track the selection decision maker.

element.formal: Date and time when the key object selection was authored. Note that this is the date and time the DICOM SOP instances in the selection were selected (selection decision making). It is different from the creation date and time of the selection resource.
element.comments: Authoring time.
element.requirements: Date and time when the selection was made can be important to understand the content of selection.

element.short: Study identity of the selected instances
element.formal: Study identity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.comments: Study component represents the study level identity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection. It is the top level identity of the hierachical identification of the instances.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the study level provide a means of retrieving the entire study.

element.formal: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: Study instance uid of the SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: Study instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

element.short: AE Title where may be retrieved
element.formal:
The DICOM Application Entity Title where the study can be retrieved.
Note that this AE Title is provided to retrieve all SOP instances of the study, not only those in the selection.
element.comments: Study level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the AE Title which supportd retrieval of the entire study, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: Application Entity Title enables retrieval of the entire study using DICOM upper layer protocol.

element.formal: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the study. Note that this URL retrieves all SOP instances of the study, not only those in the selection.
element.comments: Study level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the URL to retrieve the entire study with WADO-RS interaction, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the entire study using DICOM WADO-RS API.

element.short: Series identity of the selected instances
element.formal: Series indetity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.comments: Series component represents the series level indentity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the series level provide a means of retrieving the entire series.

element.formal: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: Series instance uid of the SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: Series instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

element.short: AE Title where may be retrieved
element.formal:
The DICOM Application Entity Title where the series can be retrieved.
Note that this AE Title is provided to retrieve all SOP instances of the series not only those in the selection.
element.comments: Series level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the AE Title which supports retrieval of the entire series, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: Application Entity Title enables retrieval of the entire series using DICOM upper layer protocol.

element.formal: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the series Note that this URL retrieves all SOP instances of the series not only those in the selection.
element.comments: Series level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the URL to retrieve the entire series with WADO-RS interaction, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the entire series using DICOM WADO-RS API.

element.formal: Identity and locating information of the selected DICOM SOP instances.
element.comments: SOP Instance component identify the instance selected in the selection, along with the study and series identities to form the DICOM identity hierachy.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. This is the instance level identity of the instance in the selection.

constraint.name: InstanceLocatorInformation
constraint.human: SHALL at least provide retrieve URL or retrieve AE Title

element.formal: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.formal: SOP class uid of the selected instance.
element.comments: SOP class uid provides the type of the selected instances, e.g., CT image, Gray scale softcopy presentation state, ECG waveform, etc.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instance can be an imaging or other data object. The SOP class uid provide the accurate information about what type the instance is.

element.formal: SOP Instance uid of the selected instance.
element.comments: SOP instance uid identifies the instance.
element.requirements: SOP instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instance in the selection.

element.short: AE Title where may be retrieved
element.formal: The DICOM Application Entity Title where the DICOM SOP instance can be retrieved.
element.comments: Instance level locator information is required. Either AE Title or URL or both must be provided.
element.requirements: Application Entity Title enables retrieval of the SOP instance using DICOM upper layer protocol.

element.formal: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the DICOM SOP Instance.
element.comments: Instance level locator information is required. Either AE Title or URL or both must be provided.
element.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the SOP instance using DICOM WADO-RS API.

element.formal: A set of DICOM SOP Instances of a patient, selected for some application purpose, e.g., quality assurance, teaching, conference, consulting, etc.  Objects selected can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
element.requirements: A FHIR representation of DICOM Key Object Selection (KOS) SOP Instances enables access to a set of selected DICOM SOP Instances.

element.formal: Instance UID of the DICOM KOS SOP Instances represenetd in this resource.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP Instance is always assigned with a unique identifier (UID).

(0008,0018) - SOP Instance UID (of the Key Object Selection SOP Class)

element.comments: SOP instances selected in the key object selection can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
element.requirements: SOP Instances in key object selection must be from the same patient.

Coded concept of kind of the key object selection. Value set is defined in the DICOM standard CID-7010.

element.formal: Author of key object selection. It can be a human authtor or a device which made the decision of the SOP instances selected. For example, a radiologist selected a set of imaging SOP instances to attached in a diagnostic report, and a CAD application may author a selection to describe SOP instances it used to generate a detection conclusion.
element.comments: Author of the key object selection. This can be a human author or a device author. Human author is represented with the HumanName type. Device author is represented with a reference to the Device resource.
element.requirements: Track the selection decision maker.

element.formal: Date and time when the key object selection was authored. Note that this is the date and time the DICOM SOP instances in the selection were selected (selection decision making). It is different from the creation date and time of the selection resource.
element.comments: Authoring time.
element.requirements: Date and time when the selection was made can be important to understand the content of selection.

element.short: Study identity of the selected instances
element.formal: Study identity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
element.comments: Study component represents the study level identity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection. It is the top level identity of the hierachical identification of the instances.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the study level provide a means of retrieving the entire study.

element.formal: Study instance uid of the SOP instances in the selection.
element.requirements: Study instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

element.short: AE Title where may be retrieved
element.formal:
The DICOM Application Entity Title where the study can be retrieved.
Note that this AE Title is provided to retrieve all SOP instances of the study, not only those in the selection.
element.comments: Study level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the AE Title which supportd retrieval of the entire study, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: Application Entity Title enables retrieval of the entire study using DICOM upper layer protocol.

element.formal: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the study. Note that this URL retrieves all SOP instances of the study, not only those in the selection.
element.comments: Study level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the URL to retrieve the entire study with WADO-RS interaction, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the entire study using DICOM WADO-RS API.

element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the series level provide a means of retrieving the entire series.

element.formal: Series instance uid of the SOP instances in the selection.

Note that this AE Title is provided to retrieve all SOP instances of the series not only those in the selection.

element.requirements: Application Entity Title enables retrieval of the entire series using DICOM upper layer protocol.

element.comments: Series level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the URL to retrieve the entire series with WADO-RS interaction, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
element.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the entire series using DICOM WADO-RS API.

element.formal: Identity and locating information of the selected DICOM SOP instances.
element.comments: SOP Instance component identify the instance selected in the selection, along with the study and series identities to form the DICOM identity hierachy.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. This is the instance level identity of the instance in the selection.

constraint.name: InstanceLocatorInformation
constraint.human: SHALL at least provide retrieve URL or retrieve AE Title

element.formal: SOP class uid of the selected instance.
element.comments: SOP class uid provides the type of the selected instances, e.g., CT image, Gray scale softcopy presentation state, ECG waveform, etc.
element.requirements: DICOM SOP instance can be an imaging or other data object. The SOP class uid provide the accurate information about what type the instance is.

element.formal: SOP Instance uid of the selected instance.
element.comments: SOP instance uid identifies the instance.
element.requirements: SOP instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instance in the selection.

element.short: AE Title where may be retrieved
element.formal: The DICOM Application Entity Title where the DICOM SOP instance can be retrieved.
element.comments: Instance level locator information is required. Either AE Title or URL or both must be provided.
element.requirements: Application Entity Title enables retrieval of the SOP instance using DICOM upper layer protocol.
